decisionLog: Heard: users requested improvement around improve empty-state onboarding.
Inferred: implement UI-only changes that shorten the feedback loop in improve empty-state onboarding.

Guardrail: no backend, schema, or auth hardening changes in this iteration.

analysis.summary: This repository is a lightweight Next.js todo application with enough UI surface to run interview-driven iteration loops quickly. It already supports list creation and task state changes, making it a good target for validated UX refinements in onboarding, prioritization, and completion flow.
capabilities: Detected 5 app route page(s) in Next.js app router.
State management appears to use Redux Toolkit.
Tailwind CSS is configured for rapid UI iteration.
App includes authentication route handlers (NextAuth-style structure).
Todo data persistence appears to rely on browser localStorage.
Codebase contains direct todo workflow components and list interactions.

directions.title: Improve Empty-State Onboarding
directions.reason: The todo flow has a basic empty state and can benefit from stronger first-task guidance.
directions.interviewFocus: Ask how users decide their first task and what guidance they expect when the list is empty.

directions.title: Clarify Priority and Next Action
directions.reason: Current list interactions are simple; users may need faster scanning and clearer next actions.
directions.interviewFocus: Probe which tasks users struggle to prioritize and what visual cues would reduce hesitation.

directions.title: Add Bulk Action Comfort
directions.reason: Deleting and toggling are item-by-item; repetitive cleanup can create friction.
directions.interviewFocus: Explore how users wrap up sessions and what batch operations they reach for most.

directions.title: Reduce Sign-In Entry Friction
directions.reason: There is an auth-gated todo route; the handoff from landing page to task entry may be unclear.
directions.interviewFocus: Ask where users hesitate in sign-in and what reassurance they need before continuing.

directions.title: Increase State Feedback Visibility
directions.reason: Redux-driven state changes happen immediately but feedback affordances are minimal.
directions.interviewFocus: Ask which confirmations or transitions would increase trust when tasks change state.
